case_vignette: A 15-year-old female presents to your office for evaluation of a painful neck mass. The family reports the patient has had a midline neck mass for many years, but had become painful over the past week with erythema at the overlying skin. The patient denies subjective fevers at home. The patient has an otherwise unremarkable past medical history. Her temperature is 100.1 deg F (37.8 deg C), blood pressure is 110/70 mmHg, pulse is 90/min, and respirations are 15/min. Clinical exam is seen in Figure A. The mass is noted to rise with deglutition and tongue protrusion.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?
